intro: Sestinia, commonly known as the common sestinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Sestinia is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its family.
